1.text: And these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.

2.text: Then was kindled the anger of Elihu the son of Barachel, the Buzite, of the family of Ram: against Job was his anger kindled, because he justified himself rather than God;

3.text: and against his three friends was his anger kindled, because they found no answer, and [yet] condemned Job.

4.text: But Elihu had waited till Job had finished speaking, because they were older than he.

5.text: And Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of the three men, and his anger was kindled.

6.text: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are aged; wherefore I was timid, and feared to shew you what I know.

7.text: I said, Let days speak, and multitude of years teach wisdom.

8.text: But there is a spirit which is in man; and the breath of the Almighty giveth them understanding.

9.text: It is not the great that are wise; neither do the aged understand judgment.

10.text: Therefore I say, Hearken to me; I also will shew what I know.

11.text: Lo, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasonings, until ye searched out what to say.

12.text: Yea, I gave you mine attention, and behold, there was none of you that confuted Job, that answered his words;

13.text: That ye may not say, We have found out wisdom; God will make him yield, not man.

14.text: Now he hath not directed [his] words against me; and I will not answer him with your speeches....

15.text: They were amazed, they answered no more; words failed them.

16.text: And I waited, for they spoke not, but stood still, and answered no more;—

17.text: I will answer, I also in my turn, I also will shew what I know:

18.text: For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.

19.text: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; like new flasks, it is ready to burst.

20.text: I will speak, that I may find relief; I will open my lips and answer.

21.text: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man’s person; neither will I give flattery to man.

22.text: For I know not how to flatter; my Maker would soon take me away.
